result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard A Boardman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Amended 6-23-17
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 16CF45 and 13CF182.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with:  the victims, or his co-defendants Donna Deloski, Jesse Dehaven, Adam Greenwald and Stephanie Treu.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.
Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: same as prison sentence.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.   Defendant plead to Theft, Count 2 in 15CF166.  Count 1, 16CF45.  Clark Co. 16CM51.  to be read in.  Joint recommendation for  8 years. 16CF45.  4 years incarceration and  4 years extended supervision.  4 years on 13CF182 concurrent, 2 years incarceration and 2 years extended supervision.  In 15CF166,  2 years incarceration and 18 months extended supervision.  Concurrent to 16CF45.  Rest.  CC.  Eligible for SAP.  Not CIP.  Victim notification complied with.  All other criminal and traffic cases and counts dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.    Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Theft, contrary to 943.20(1)(a) in 15CF166 and Burglary, contrary to 943.10(1m)(a) in 16CF45.  Clark Co. 16CM51.  Jackson Co.  15CM88, 15CT24,15CF80, 15CF181 and traffic citations  dismissed, but read in.  

State recommended: 8 years total in 16CF45.  4 years incarceration and 4 years extended supervision. 15CF181:  Koehler $500.00 rest.  15CF166: $3450.00.  8,000 approx.  other.  Eligible for SAP.  Concurrent with 13CF182.  15CF166:  3 1/2 years total.   2 years incarceration and 18 months extended supervision.   Concurrent with 16CF45.  25% of prison funds to go toward restitution.  Defense is in agreement with the recommendation.  

Court ordered:  8 years total in 16CF45.  4 years incarceration and 4 years extended supervision. Concurrent with 13CF182.  In 15CF166:  3 1/2 years total.   2 years incarceration and 18 months extended supervision.   Concurrent with 16CF45, 13CF182.  

25% of prison funds to go toward restitution. 15CF181:  Koehler $500.00 rest.  15CF166: $3450.00.  8,000 approx.  other.  Eligible for SAP.  

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  Random testing.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Restitution.  Pay monthly through extended supervision  15CF166.  D.B  3450.00.  15CF80 Bremmer $500.00.  Am Family 7583.85.  15CF181 Koehler $500.00.  Obtain and maintain employment upon release.  25% of prison funds ordered applied to rest.  No contact with the victims. or co-defendants, Donna D.  Jesse Dehaven.  Adam Greenwald.  Stephanie Treu.  Eligible for SAP.  Not CIP.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Attorney Fredrickson requested sequestration of the witnesses.  State called Det. M.K.  sworn.  Employment and training described by the witness.  9/20/15.  On duty.  Witness described the call and investigation.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflected the identification.  Attorney Fredrickson cross examined the witness.  State redirect.  State called Capt. K.B.  sworn.  Employed w/JASO approx. 10 years.  Witness described the search of the defendant's residence and her investigation.  Attorney Fredrickson cross examined the witness.  No further questions.  State called Deputy D.S., sworn.  Employed w/JASO for approx. 4 years.  Training described.  On duty 9/2/15.  Witness described the call and investigation.  Attorney Fredrickson cross examined the witness.  No redirect by State.  No other witnesses.  State moved for bind over.  Court found probable cause.
